contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox president | name='''José E. de Uriburu''' | image= JEUriburu 2.jpg | nationality= {{ARG}} | order=[[President of Argentina]] | term_start=January 24, 1895 | term_end=October 11, 1898 | predecessor=[[Luis Sáenz Peña]] | successor=[[Julio Argentino Roca|Julio A. Roca]] | birth_date=November 19, 1831 | birth_place= [[Salta Province|Salta]] | death_date={{death date and age|1914|10|23|1831|11|19}} | death_place= [[Buenos Aires]] | spouse=Virginia Uriburu<br>Leonor Tezanos Pinto | party=[[National Autonomist Party]] | vicepresident= | profession=[[Lawyer]] | relations=Evaristo de Uriburu(''father'')<br>María Josefa Alvarez de Arenales(''mother'') | children= Rita, Sara, Jorge, Carlos and Virginia de Uriburu<small> (With Virginia Uriburu)</small><br>José Evaristo, Jr and Leonor de Uriburu <small>(With Leonor Tezanos Pinto)</small> }} '''José Evaristo de Uriburu y Álvarez de Arenales''' (November 19, 1831 – October 23, 1914<ref>[http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/619777/Jose-Evaristo-Uriburu Encyclopædia Britannica]</ref>) was [[President of Argentina]] from 23 January 1895 to 12 October 1898. He was an adept [[diplomat]]; participating as arbiter on the peace negotiations on the [[War of the Pacific]] between [[Chile]], [[Peru|Perú]] and [[Bolivia]]. He was Vice-President and became [[President of Argentina]] in 1895 when [[Luis Sáenz Peña]] resigned. ==Work in office as President== * Reformed the [[Constitution_of_Argentina|National Constitution]] in 1898. * Created the National Lottery (''Lotería Nacional de Beneficencia''). * Created the [[Museo Nacional de Bellas Artes]] [[Buenos Aires]]. * Created the [[Otto Krause Technical School]]. ==Other offices held== * Federal Judge, [[Salta]] (1872-1874) * National Deputy (lower house of Congress) * Huse President (1876-1877) * Justice Minister under [[Bartolomé Mitre]] for a short time (1867). * Senator for the City of Buenos Aires (1901 - 1910) == References == {{Commons category}} {{reflist}} {{S-start}} {{s-off}} {{succession box | before = [[Carlos Pellegrini]] | title = [[Vice President of Argentina]]| years = 1892–1895 | after = [[Roberto Quirno Costa]]}} {{succession box | before = [[Luis Sáenz Peña]]| title = [[List of Presidents of Argentina|President of Argentina]]| years = 1895–1898 | after = [[Julio Argentino Roca|Julio A. Roca]]}} {{S-end}} {{Presidents of Argentina}} {{Authority control|VIAF=75816665}} {{Persondata | NAME =Uriburu, Jose Evaristo | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = President of Argentina | DATE OF BIRTH =November 19, 1831 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Salta Province|Salta]] | DATE OF DEATH =October 15, 1914 | PLACE OF DEATH =[[Buenos Aires]] }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Uriburu, Jose Evaristo}} [[Category:1831 births|Uriburu, José Evaristo]] [[Category:1914 deaths|Uriburu, José Evaristo]] [[Category:People from Salta Province]] [[Category:Argentine people of Basque descent]] [[Category:Ambassadors of Argentina to Chile]] [[Category:Vice-Presidents of Argentina|Uriburu, José Evaristo]] [[Category:Presidents of Argentina|Uriburu, José Evaristo]] [[Category:Argentine lawyers|Uriburu, José Evaristo]] [[Category:National Autonomist Party politicians]] [[Category:Burials at La Recoleta Cemetery]] {{Argentina-politician-stub}}
